intro: Anisomeles leucotricha, commonly known as the white-haired dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive white, silky hairs covering its stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that bloom in summer, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
